intro: Ecbolium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Ecbolium angustifolium is often found in temperate regions of North America.
